 returns the interpolated value at position (x,y).

float kI_GetPixelInterpolatedFast (float x, float y, const TIntImage *pInfo)
 A faster version of kI_GetPixelInterpolated(), no range checking and origo must be (0,0).

Detailed Description

Kernel ANSI C only routines, last updated 12/5/1999.

Basic IntImage functions to be used as stand alone c functions only. The C++ part does not use these functions.

Version:
1.00
Author:
René Dencker Eriksen edr@mip.sdu.dk

Define Documentation

#define kI_GetPixelMacro (  x,
y,
Image    )     ((Image).ppMatrix[y][x])
 

Macro function for accessing pixels in a float image.

The macro is very fast, but be carefull when using the macro, there are no type and range checking. Origo always (0,0).

Parameters:
x  (int) x-position
y  (int) y-position
Image  (TIntImage) The image to access pixel in.

Definition at line 372 of file i_kernel_functions.h.

#define kI_SetPixelMacro (  x,
y,
Color,
Image    )     ((Image).ppMatrix[y][x]=Color);
 

Macro function for setting pixels in a float image.

The macro is very fast, but be carefull when using the macro, there are no type and range checking. Origo always (0,0).

Parameters:
x  (int) x-position
y  (int) y-position
Image  (TIntImage) The image to set pixel in.
